results.title: ER
results.brief_description: Explores the inner workings of an urban teaching hospital and the critical issues faced by the dedicated physicians and staff of its overburdened emergency room.

results.title: Equus
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Lester Persky, Elliott Kastner, Denis Holt and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Peter Firth plays Alan Strang, a young man working as a stableboy at an upper-class riding school who one night brutally blinds the horses. Richard Burton is psychiatrist Dr. Martin Dysart who is investigating the reasons for the young man’s apparent senseless crime. Based on Peter Shaffer’s acclaimed play, “Equus” is a film that explores and manages to traverse a rich field of themes and concerns: psychoanalysis and mythology; sexuality and repression; class and family; sex and power. The relationship between analyst and patient becomes increasingly complex as the mysteries of the boy’s repressions become unravelled. The men’s exchanges begin to be complicated by the echoes of homoeroticism and the psychological overtones of the Oedipal Complex. Though dominated by the performances of Burton and Firth, “Equus” features an excellent supporting cast including Joan Plowright, Eileen Atkins and Jenny Agutter. Initially dividing critics, “Equus” has become a cult favourite through the years and is acknowledged as one of Lumet’s darker and innovative works.

results.title: Equipment
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions on how to clean kitchen equipment; loosen, dissolve and emulsify dirt; rinse and dry equipment; and prevent food poisoning.

results.title: Equilibrium: the limit of disorder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Defines equilibrium as a state of balance between the conflicting requirements for minimum internal energy and maximum entropy of a system and shows that free energy is at a minimum in the condition of equilibrium. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Equilibrium
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Deals with three questions: What is chemical equilibrium? How does the chemist recognise it? How does he explain it? In answering the questions the film stresses the dynamic nature of equilibrium. An Analogy in terms of fish population in two connected bowls, and animation using molecular models, present the concepts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Equality and development
results.creator_credit: Mark Robbins, Elspeth MacDougall, Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
Made during International Women’s Year, 1975, this film is about an International Women’s Forum discussing equal rights for women. In Tunisia, small changes have begun, but more is needed. Women need more education, and employment opportunities; to eradicate illiteracy and teach family planning. The cities and amusements belong to the men - this is to be changed.

results.title: Equalibrium
results.brief_description: One of the layers of this Equalibrium consists of an image of a Sufi like spinning dancer in a white lab coat. This out-take from an earlier film, Phonogramme, had somehow become splattered with a kind of mould that formed small flower like shapes in the frame. It is combined with a loop of hand-painted film which deteriorates slowly each time the loop repeats.
